title: (0Day) AVG AntiVirus Free icarus Arbitrary File Creation Denial of Service Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows local attackers to create a denial-of-service condition on affected installations of AVG AntiVirus Free. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the AVG Installer. By creating a symbolic link, an attacker can abuse the update functionality to create a file. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to create a persistent denial-of-service condition on the system.
addtionnal_details:
02/22/24 – ZDI submitted the vulnerability via GenDigital’s webform to be managed by a third-party Vulnerability Disclosure program02/29/24 – The third-party Vulnerability Disclosure program confirmed the reported behavior04/03/24 – ZDI asked for updates06/26/24 – ZDI informed the vendor that since we’ve not received a response that we will publish the case as a zero-day advisory07/03/24 – The vendor communicated that the issue was not fixed and requested an extension07/11/24 – ZDI requested an estimated release date07/19/24 – The vendor confirmed that the issue was being investigated07/26/24 – ZDI notified the vendor of the intention to publish the cases as 0-day advisory on 07/29/24

-- Mitigation: Given the nature of the vulnerability, the only salient mitigation strategy is to restrict interaction with the application.
